item.title: Vikki add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Still it might be nice, once in a while, not to have to choose between evils. Just once, couldn't I choose the lesser good?" -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "Procrastinate now, don't put it off." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "Let me tell you this: if you meet a loner, no matter what they tell you, it's not because they enjoy solitude. It's because they have tried to blend into the world before, and people continue to disappoint them." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Vikki add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "Everybody's got to believe in something. I believe I'll have another beer." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Hereâ€™s to books, the cheapest vacation you can buy." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Jarod Kintz
item.description: "Laughter is the sound of the soul dancing. My soul probably looks like Fred Astaire." -- Jarod Kintz

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "I really don't think I need buns of steel. I'd be happy with buns of cinnamon." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent. To sit with a dog on a hillside on a glorious afternoon is to be back in Eden, where doing nothing was not boring--it was peace." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Vikki add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Can the sarcasm,' he said. 'Please, I always use fresh sarcasm, never canned." -- Laurell K. Hamilton
